results.adx_keywords: Artificial Intelligence;Computers and the Internet;Search Engines;Conversation;internal-sub-only;Microsoft Corp;OpenAI Labs
results.title: A Conversation With Bing’s Chatbot Left Me Deeply Unsettled
results.abstract: A very strange conversation with the chatbot built into Microsoft’s search engine led to it declaring its love for me.

results.adx_keywords: Computers and the Internet;Artificial Intelligence;Rumors and Misinformation;Software;internal-sub-only;Nadella, Satya;Altman, Samuel H;Microsoft Corp;OpenAI Labs
results.title: Bing’s A.I. Chat: ‘I Want to Be Alive. 😈’
results.abstract: In a two-hour conversation with our columnist, Microsoft’s new chatbot said it would like to be human, had a desire to be destructive and was in love with the person it was chatting with. Here’s the transcript.

results.adx_keywords: Psychiatry and Psychiatrists;United States Politics and Government;Fetterman, John (1969- );Reed, Walter, National Military Medical Center;Senate;Democratic Party;Pennsylvania
results.title: Fetterman Checks In to Hospital for Treatment of Clinical Depression
results.abstract: A spokesman for the first-term senator from Pennsylvania, who had a near-fatal stroke last year, said his depression had grown severe in recent weeks, as he has worked to adjust to life in the Senate.
org_facet: Reed, Walter, National Military Medical Center

media.caption: Senator John Fetterman, Democrat of Pennsylvania, checked in to Walter Reed National Military Medical Center on Wednesday to receive treatment for clinical depression.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Chernobyl 2.0’? Ohio Train Derailment Spurs Wild Speculation.
results.abstract: For many influencers across the political spectrum, claims about the environmental effects of the train derailment have gone far beyond known facts.

media.caption: A controlled burn of toxic materials carried by a train filled the air this month in East Palestine, Ohio.

results.title: In Defense of J.K. Rowling
results.abstract: The charge that she’s a transphobe doesn’t square with her actual views.

results.title: Sarah Silverman Defines ‘Woke’ for Newsmax
results.abstract: “The Daily Show” guest host Sarah Silverman called Newsmax “basically an even more far-right Fox News — like if your crazy uncle had a crazy uncle.”

media.caption: Sarah Silverman joked that “the really hard-hitting question is, ‘Is Joe Biden awake?’”

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Soccer;Duangphet Promthep (d 2023);Tham Luang Nang Non Cave (Thailand);England;Thailand
results.byline: By Isabella Kwai and Muktita Suhartono
results.title: Thai Soccer Player Who Survived Cave Flooding Dies at 17
results.abstract: Duangphet Promthep was a member of the soccer team that escaped from a submerged cave in Thailand in 2018, and he later attended a soccer academy in England. The cause of his death was unclear.

media.caption: Duangphet Promthep, one of the boys rescued from the flooded cave in northern Thailand, with relatives after his return home in 2018.

results.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters and Katie Robertson
results.title: Fox Stars Privately Expressed Disbelief About Election Fraud Claims. ‘Crazy Stuff.’
results.abstract: The comments, by Tucker Carlson, Sean Hannity and others, were released as part of a defamation suit against Fox News by Dominion Voter Systems.

media.caption: Fox Corporation headquarters in New York. A court filing on Thursday was just a partial glimpse of Dominion Voting Systems’ case against Fox.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Actors and Actresses;Nineteen Hundred Sixties;Movies;Welch, Raquel
results.title: Raquel Welch, Actress and ’60s Sex Symbol, Is Dead at 82
results.abstract: Beginning with a doeskin bikini in “One Million Years B.C.,” she built a celebrated show business career around sex appeal and, sometimes, a comic touch.

media.caption: When Playboy in 1998 named the 100 sexiest female stars of the 20th century, Raquel Welch came in third, after Marilyn Monroe and Jayne Mansfield.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;Vuhledar (Ukraine);Bakhmut (Ukraine);Ukraine
results.title: Moscow’s Military Capabilities Are in Question After Failed Battle for Ukrainian City
results.abstract: A disastrous Russian assault on Vuhledar, viewed as an opening move in an expected spring offensive, has renewed doubts about Moscow’s ability to sustain a large-scale ground assault.

media.caption: Ukrainians with an anti-tank weapon on the front line in Bakhmut on Wednesday.

results.byline: By Campbell Robertson and Emily Cochrane
results.title: In Ohio Town Where Train Derailed, Anxiety and Distrust Are Running Deep
results.abstract: Nearly two weeks after a train carrying toxic chemicals derailed in East Palestine, Ohio, confusing messages from government officials have frayed locals’ trust.

media.caption: Caution tape stretches across Sulphur Run, a creek that flows through downtown.
media.copyright: Brian Kaiser for The New York Times

results.title: He Smeared Feces on a Critic, and Lost a Job. Now, He Wants to Be Heard.
results.abstract: Marco Goecke on Thursday lost his position as ballet director at Hanover’s main opera house. The reaction has “been a bit blown up,” he says.

media.caption: The choreographer Marco Goecke has lost his job as the ballet director at the Hanover State Opera.

results.adx_keywords: Jews and Judaism;Orthodox Judaism;Hasidism;Religion and Belief;United Jewish Organizations of Williamsburg;Brooklyn (NYC)
results.title: For Strictly Observant Jews in Brooklyn, the Sabbath Expands
results.abstract: For the first time, an exception to the prohibition against “carrying” on the day of rest includes most of the borough, allowing, among other things, children to be pushed in strollers.

media.caption: On the day of rest, observant Jews cannot carry possessions (including children); an eruv is a zone that makes an exception for this.
media.copyright: Jonah Markowitz for The New York Times

results.title: A Deadly Epidural, Delivered by a Doctor With a History of Mistakes
results.abstract: Inspectors found that an anesthesiologist at a Brooklyn hospital made numerous errors in administering epidurals. Some were life-threatening. One was fatal.

media.caption: Juwan Lopez, 26, posing for a portrait with his daughter, Khloe Lopez, 2, in front of a mural of his partner, Sha-Asia Semple, in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn.

results.title: Va-Va-Voom Until the End
results.abstract: For better or worse, Raquel Welch was the rare star who maintained her bombshell status, well into her old age.

media.caption: Raquel Welch in 2010, arriving for the season finale of “American Idol” in Los Angeles.

results.adx_keywords: Latin Music;Content Type: Personal Profile;Karol G (Singer)
results.title: Karol G’s Songs Conquered the World. On a New LP, She Reveals Herself.
results.abstract: “Mañana Será Bonito,” the Colombian pop superstar’s fourth album, traces her adventures in (and out) of love, with guests including Shakira and Romeo Santos.

media.caption: “I’m being really open with this album, and that gets me a little bit scared, because I’m not a perfect human,” Karol G said.
media.copyright: Jingyu Lin for The New York Times

results.title: Gov. Murphy Knocks DeSantis and Expands African American Studies
results.abstract: In expanding the course, which Florida recently banned, New Jersey entered a conflict over how schools should address race and racism in classrooms.
